thread.title: Tottenham well placed to fight off any bid for Mauricio Pochettino from soon-to-be-managerless Barcelona
thread.title_full: Tottenham well placed to fight off any bid for Mauricio Pochettino from soon-to-be-managerless Barcelona

author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Tottenham well placed to fight off any bid for Mauricio Pochettino from soon-to-be-managerless Barcelona
text:
Barca president Bartomeu reacts to Luis Enrique announcement Share this video Watch Next Read More The stresses of football management: Before and after pictures of seven bosses who aged RAPIDLY in one job 
Mirror Sport understands the Spurs manager's links to Barcelona’s city rivals Espanyol - he both played for and then and managed them - would not put him off the Nou Camp job, although he insisted last month he is happy at Tottenham. 
And Tottenham are in a strong position if Barca do try to turn to the Spanish-speaking Argentine. Buyout clause not visible... BECAUSE THERE WASN'T ONE! (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty) Read More Kane reveals his biggest fear in football as another trophyless season looms for Spurs 
He signed a new £5.5m-a-year deal last year that runs until 2021 and, crucially, doesn’t include a buyout clause. 
If any Barcelona approach was forthcoming, chairman Daniel Levy is prepared to respond by putting a huge price tag on Pochettino’s head that would scare them off. Like us on Facebook
